channel.title: CyberNetSec - Data Breach
channel.description: Latest data breach threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: AI Social Network "Moltbook" Breach Exposes 1.5M API Keys and 29k User Emails
item.description:
A significant data breach at the AI-focused social network 'Moltbook' has exposed 1.5 million API keys, 29,000 user emails, and other sensitive data tables. The investigation, conducted by security firm Wiz, not only uncovered the data exposure but also revealed systemic security flaws, such as a la...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: UStrive Mentoring Platform Exposes Data of 238,000 Users, Including Minors, via Leaky API
item.description:
The non-profit mentoring platform UStrive has inadvertently exposed the sensitive personal data of over 238,000 users due to a misconfigured GraphQL API endpoint. A significant portion of the exposed user base includes minors, elevating the severity and privacy implications of the incident. The leak...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Policy and Compliance, Cloud Security

Read Full Article →

item.title: Automated Attacks Wipe Exposed MongoDB Databases, Demanding $500 Ransom
item.description:
An automated data extortion campaign is actively targeting publicly exposed and misconfigured MongoDB databases. A threat actor is systematically wiping data from these unsecured servers and leaving a ransom note demanding approximately $500 in Bitcoin for its return. Research from Flare identified ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Cyberattack, Data Breach, Cloud Security

item.title: Air Conditioning Giant Blue Star Discloses Data Breach Affecting Product Installation Data
item.description:
Blue Star, a major Indian multinational specializing in air conditioning and commercial refrigeration, has announced it experienced a data security incident. The company reported unauthorized access to its product installation data. The breach was reported to its Compliance Officer on January 31, 20...

Severity: Low

Categories: Data Breach, Incident Response, Industrial Control Systems

item.title: Cognizant Sued in Class-Action Lawsuits After TriZetto Data Breach
item.description:
IT services giant Cognizant Technology Solutions is facing multiple class-action lawsuits in the U.S. following a significant data breach at its healthcare subsidiary, TriZetto Provider Solutions (TPS). The lawsuits, filed in New Jersey and Missouri, allege that Cognizant failed to adequately protec...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Security Operations

item.title: SoundCloud Breach Exposes Private Emails of 29.8 Million Users
item.description:
A significant data breach at the music streaming service SoundCloud has resulted in the public release of a database containing the personal details of 29.8 million users. The data was leaked in January 2026 after the company reportedly refused to pay a ransom demand. The primary risk from this brea...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Intelligence

item.title: ShinyHunters Claims Breach of Crunchbase, Betterment via Okta Vishing Attacks
item.description:
The notorious cyber extortion syndicate ShinyHunters has claimed responsibility for breaching business intelligence firm Crunchbase and financial advisory company Betterment. According to the threat actor, the initial access was gained by using sophisticated voice phishing (vishing) attacks to socia...

item.title: ShinyHunters Claims Breach of 10M Match Group Users from Hinge & OkCupid
item.description:
The notorious cybercrime group ShinyHunters has claimed responsibility for a major data breach impacting Match Group, the parent company of popular dating apps like Hinge, OkCupid, and Match.com. The group posted on a dark web forum that it has stolen over 10 million user records, and released a 1.7...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: Nova Ransomware Group Claims Cyberattack on KPMG Netherlands, Sets 10-Day Deadline
item.description:
The Nova ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against the Netherlands division of global professional services firm KPMG. The claim, which appeared on ransomware monitoring services on January 23, 2026, alleges that the group successfully breached KPMG's systems and exfiltra...

Severity: High

item.title: Illinois DHS Exposes Data of 700,000 Residents in Massive Misconfiguration Breach
item.description:
The Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) has disclosed a major data breach affecting approximately 705,000 state residents. The breach was caused by incorrect privacy settings on internal planning maps that were inadvertently made public on a mapping website for up to four years. The exposed...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance
